biography.0: Lundh, Asta Evilla, med. lic., leg. tandläkare, Sthlm, f. i Bunkeflo, Malmöh. l., av lär. Hans L. o. Hanna L. G. 31 m. Waldemar Samuelsson. Barn : Kjell f. 32. Stud:ex. i Malmö 13, med. kand. 19 i Lund, med. lic. 16 i Sthlm, tandlrex. i Sthlm 23. Prakt, läkare o. tandl. i Sthlm sed. 26, tandläkare v. Sthlms folksk. sed. 27.
biography.1: Lundh, Astor Benvard, amanuens, Sthlm, f. 13/5/94 i Väsby förs., Malmöhus 1. Stud :ex. i H:borg 13, fil. kand. i Lund 14, muntlig tentamen i lic :ex. i nationalekonomi 17. Aman. i Sthlms stads statistiska kont. 18-19, aman. o. t. f. registrator i Kgl. skolöverstyr. 19-20, tjg. i Kgl. statskont. m. aman:- o. rev:förordn. 20-23, lär. i nationalekon. v. Sthlms Borgarsk. 20-21, tj:m. i Riksförsäkr:anst. fr. 24. Av Folkbildn:förb. antagen s. föreläs, i nat:ekon. o. socialpolitiska ämnen. Sekr. i styr. f. Psykologiska klubb, i Sthlm. Hobbies: Fotografi o. boksamling.

biography_translated.0: Lundh, Asta Evilla, M.D., licensed dentist, Stockholm, born in Bunkeflo, Malmöhus county, the daughter of teacher Hans L. and Hanna L. G. Married to Waldemar Samuelsson with one son, Kjell, born in 1932. Asta Lundh graduated from high school in Malmö in 1913, earned a medical degree from Lund University in 1919, a dental license in Stockholm in 1923, and a medical license in Stockholm in 1916. She worked as a medical practitioner and dentist in Stockholm since 1926, also serving as a dentist for Stockholm's public schools since 1927.
biography_translated.1: Lundh, Astor Benvard, assistant, Stockholm, born on May 13th, 1894 in Väsby parish, Malmöhus county. Completed his student examination in Helsingborg in 1913 and received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Lund in 1914. Passed an oral examination for a Licentiate in Economics in 1917. Worked as an assistant at the statistical office of Stockholm City in 1918-1919, and as an assistant and temporary registrar at the Royal Board of Education in 1919-1920. Served as employee with assistant and auditing assignments at the Royal Audit Office in 1920-1923 and as a teacher of economics at Stockholm Civic School in 1920-1921. Worked as a civil servant at the National Insurance Agency from 1924 and was approved by the National Association for Popular Education as a speaker on economic and social policy topics. Secretary of the board of the Psychological Club in Stockholm. Hobbies include photography and book collecting.
